intro: Barleria cristata, commonly known as the crownvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. Barleria cristata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in erosion control due to its extensive root system.
